result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone L Johnikin Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyrone L Johnikin Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyrone L Johnikin Jr was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Tyrone L Johnikin Jr was found guilty of Possession of Marijuana. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant pay $150.00 fine PLUS all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by August 11, 2016. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.

**Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs in 60 days ordered on count 3 and 1 year on count 2 and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone L Johnikin Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 2:

Court sentences defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant pay $150.00 fine PLUS all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges by August 11, 2016. Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment.
.

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs in 60 days ordered on count 3 and 1 year on count 2 and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Tyrone L Johnikin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

On motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

AS TO COUNT 3:

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC, contrary to County ordinance section(s) 24.01, a Class forfeiture.
Defendant enters a plea of guilty. Court found the Defendant guilty. Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs to be paid by 10-13-2015 or Civil Judgment.
From family, friend's and businesses on behalf of the defendant; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Tyrone L Johnikin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel just received additional discovery at today's proceedings.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone L Johnikin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record. Defense has requested authorization for DPA resolution in this case.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrone L Johnikin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status conference.   
Defense counsel would like some time to negotiate case with the state. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyrone L Johnikin in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for arraignment. Defense counsel received discovery and offer, additional time to review with her client.  Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEMARCUS M-W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Tyrone L Johnikin in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Tyrone L Johnikin in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Motion to dismiss by the defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE, argued and GRANTED by the Court.  COUNT ONE DISMISSED.
AS TO COUNTS 2 & 3:  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  COURT RESERVES DEFENDANT'S RIGHT TO SUBSTITUTE.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
